definition: the act of proving that an instrument purporting to be a will was signed and executed in accord with legal requirements, establish the legal validity of (wills and other documents)
details:
noun
- the act of proving that an instrument purporting to be a will was signed and executed in accord with legal requirements
- a judicial certificate saying that a will is genuine and conferring on the executors the power to administer the estate
= synonyms: probate will
verb
- establish the legal validity of (wills and other documents)
- put a convicted person on probation by suspending his sentence
